question: Companies typically use personal selling as the promotional strategy of choice when which of these is true?

answers.text: The product is higher in price.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Product variation is only one factor in deciding to use a personal selling strategy.

answers.text: The product requires the sales professional to spend significant time educating the customer.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Time educating the customer is only one factor in deciding to use a personal selling strategy.

answers.text: The product has a lot of variation.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Price is only one factor in deciding to use a personal selling strategy.

answers.text: All of these statements are true.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Personal selling is used by companies when they have a product that needs explanation and education, it is higher in price, and it can be varied according to the needs of the customer.

detailedSolution: Personal selling is used by companies when they have a product that needs explanation and education, it is higher in price, and it can be varied according to the needs of the customer.
